revised_title: Experimental Analysis of Fermentation Processes and Their Products
tldr: The author conducts a series of experiments on vinous, acetous, and putrefactive fermentations, analyzing the chemical changes and products formed. He concludes that sugar is not the only vegetable matter decomposed during fermentation and that olefiant gas plays a significant role in the process. The author also discusses the formation of carbonic acid and other substances during fermentation and challenges the concept of alcohol and ether as separate, distinct principles.
